content: placeholder
@T-release meeting!
@DPC triage checkin?
had a meeting on wednesday, Camelid has joined the team, nothing much was discussed besides that
ok
moving on, we have a clippy ICE fix nominated for stable backport: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77750
@cuviper -- do you know if we expect an LLVM 11 backport to stable this cycle? (i.e., does it make sense to wait for that)?
I wasn't planning on that
ok
Maybe to beta once 11 is final, but I wouldn't touch stable unless we know it fixes something
makes sense
Is anyone opposed to stable-accepting this (but not issuing a point release at this time)?
wouldn't stable-accept be done by the clippy team?
er, well, I think they're already fine with it
but I just mean "are we okay including this if there is in fact a point release"
maybe not important to talk about now
@triagebot await

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
emojis broke
On the triage thing? Looks fine on android
hm, working for me
I think zulip's emojis require refreshing sometimes
maybe it's because I add them in parallel or something
I should file an issue, though reproducing it is hard
anyway, moving on -- I don't personally have any sync discussion, but wanted people to be aware of https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/706
and https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/77725
if you have thoughts, please leave those on the two PRs
ok, @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
(more UI fun, it flipped the emoji order while I was pressing mine...)
@XAMPPRocky take it away

One thing I wanted to bring up, was what would people think about using the meeting after a release be a mini-retrospective on the release itself?

There’s often smaller things that come to mind after a release that don’t feel appropriate as their own topic.
Do you want that as an immediate post-mortem, or maybe in a week so it settles?

What I was specifically thinking about this time was that I’ve a few comments expressing concern about using LLVM rc in the release, which to me says we should probably document our LLVM policy better so it’s more clear to users why it’s that way.
Is there a reason you expect sync discussion to be useful on this?
Generally speaking I'm all for it though
i.e., policy or bringing things up
I think a page on forge would be great to help (write) document our llvm policy
Well, for LLVM 11 in particular, I would say it was only early because we wanted the compile time gain. In general, I'd rather wait for its release.
And we did hope that 11 would be final in time
weren't we running off master until a couple llvm releases ago?
yeah I think so
or semi-master?

@simulacrum The reason I think it’s specifically useful as sync is for members to make comments about a release without committing to anything. Another example was you and @Pietro Albini mentioned delaying or changing the release cycle this time, I would be interested in knowing more about that.
We were using matter snapshots, yes, somewhat arbitrarily
@XAMPPRocky I guess I would find it helpful to synthesize my thoughts async more on that sort of thing
like, I don't feel prepared to discuss things in detail :)
@XAMPPRocky the reason for that was we had three major regressions like until monday or tuesday
if I actually wanted to delay the release I'd have pinged the whole release team
Okay, but is there a feeling that six weeks is too short now?
dunno
I'd need to think more about it :)
yeah not sure personally, I think maybe, but maybe not
i think we just need to be prepared with a plan in case regressions show up late
I don't know that we can be, dealing with them always feels very case-by-case to me at least
agreed
Yeah to get back to the original topic, I think we could do something like a very loose discussion on the Friday after a release, and have a more detailed discussion from that the following week.

I don't personally have more thoughts on this, but I would suggest @XAMPPRocky (or others) that if you feel there's outstanding questions we start issue threads on rust-lang/release-team, I would find that easier to respond to and process
That’s all from me.
@triagebot end-meeting then

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
okay, let's call it here. thanks everyone! o/
just chiming in to say I am grateful for your work in keeping the release train uninterrupted (i.e. release was not delayed), and that I am a great fan of the 6-week release schedule
